description: Basic être and avoir sentences with simple adjectives

sentences.explanation: Basic être conjugation: je suis. 'Heureux' (masculine) / 'heureuse' (feminine).
Être conjugation: elle est. 'Grande' (feminine form) agrees with 'elle'.
Être conjugation: nous sommes. 'Étudiants' (masculine plural) - mixed groups use masculine.
Avoir conjugation: tu as. 'Un chien' (masculine singular with indefinite article).
Avoir conjugation: ils ont. 'Des livres' (plural indefinite article + plural noun).
'La maison' (feminine). 'Grande' (feminine adjective) agrees with 'maison'.
Nationality adjectives: 'français' (masculine) / 'française' (feminine). No capital letter for adjectives.
Numbers with plural nouns. 'Trois chats' (three cats - plural, no article with numbers).
Être with adjectives. 'Fatigués' (masculine plural) - default for mixed groups.
'La voiture' (feminine). Color adjective 'rouge' is invariable (same for masculine/feminine).
Être with personality adjectives. 'Gentil' (masculine) / 'gentille' (feminine).
J'ai = je + ai (contraction). 'Une sœur' (feminine family member).
Plural: 'les étudiants sont jeunes'. Adjective 'jeunes' agrees with plural noun.
Professions with être. 'Professeure' (feminine form of teacher). No article with professions after être.
Avoir conjugation: nous avons. 'Nouvelle' (feminine form of 'new') comes before the noun.
'Ce sont' (they are) for identification. 'Mes amis' (my friends - plural possessive).
Age expressions use 'avoir': j'ai 20 ans (literally 'I have 20 years'). 'Ans' not 'années' for age.
Plural agreement: 'les livres sont intéressants'. Masculine plural adjective ending in -s.
Body parts use definite article: 'les yeux' (the eyes). 'Marron' is invariable (doesn't change).
Intensifier 'très' (very). 'Belle' (feminine form of beautiful). 'Beau' → 'belle' (irregular).
Color adjectives usually come after the noun. 'Un stylo bleu' (a blue pen).
Location with être + preposition. 'À la maison' (at home/at the house).
'Le chien' (masculine). 'Petit' (masculine adjective for small).
Body parts with definite article. 'Les cheveux noirs' (black hair - plural in French).
Professions after être (no article). 'Médecins' (plural form of doctor).
Location with être + dans (in). 'Dans le jardin' (in the garden).
Color agreement: 'blanche' (feminine form of white). 'Une robe blanche' (a white dress).
Physical states with avoir: 'avoir faim' (to be hungry). Not être in French!
Present tense: 'ils/elles jouent' (they play/are playing). 'Les enfants' (the children).
Numbers with family members. 'Deux frères' (two brothers - no article with numbers).
Personality adjectives. 'Intelligent' (masculine) / 'intelligente' (feminine).
'La table' (feminine). 'Marron' is invariable (doesn't change for gender/number).
Adjective before noun: 'un gros problème'. 'Gros' (masculine) / 'grosse' (feminine).
'C'est' for identification. 'Ma mère' (my mother - feminine possessive).
Physical states with avoir: 'avoir soif' (to be thirsty). French uses avoir, not être.
Plural agreement: 'les fleurs sont jolies'. Feminine plural adjective 'jolies'.
Plural indefinite article 'des'. Color agreement: 'vertes' (feminine plural of green).
Location with être + dans. 'Dans la cuisine' (in the kitchen).
Pain expressions: 'avoir mal à + body part'. 'Mal à la tête' (headache).
'C'est' + article + adjective + noun. 'Bonne' (feminine form of good) before noun.
Physical sensations with avoir: 'avoir froid' (to be cold). Not être in French.
Present tense: 'il/elle dort' (he/she sleeps/is sleeping). 'Le chat' (the cat).
Body parts with definite article. 'Longs' (masculine plural) agrees with 'cheveux'.
Possessive adjectives: 'mon ami' (my friend - masculine). 'Ma' → 'mon' before vowel sound.
'La porte' (feminine). 'Ouverte' (feminine form of open) agrees with 'porte'.
Quantity expression: 'beaucoup d'amis' (many friends). 'De' + plural noun.
Present tense: 'elle porte' (she wears/is wearing). 'Un chapeau' (a hat).
Emotions with avoir: 'avoir peur' (to be afraid). French uses avoir, not être.
'La fenêtre' (feminine). 'Fermée' (feminine form of closed) agrees with 'fenêtre'.
Adjective before noun: 'un beau sourire'. 'Beau' (masculine form of beautiful).
Present tense: 'ils déjeunent' (they have/are having lunch). Meal-specific verb.
State with être: 'être pressé' (to be in a hurry). 'Pressé' (masculine) / 'pressée' (feminine).
Body parts with definite article. 'Les yeux bleus' (blue eyes - masculine plural).
Time expressions: 'être en retard' (to be late). Fixed expression with 'en'.
Present tense: 'il/elle pleure' (he/she cries/is crying). 'Le bébé' (the baby).
Color after noun: 'une voiture rouge'. 'Rouge' is invariable (same for all genders).
Intensifier 'très' (very). 'Gentil' (masculine) / 'gentille' (feminine) for kind.
'La soupe' (feminine). 'Chaude' (feminine form of hot) agrees with 'soupe'.
School vocabulary: 'des devoirs' (homework - always plural in French).
Present tense: 'elle lit' (she reads/is reading). Irregular verb 'lire' (to read).
Time expressions: 'aujourd'hui' (today). 'Heureux' (masculine) / 'heureuse' (feminine).
'Le café' (masculine). 'Froid' (masculine form of cold) agrees with 'café'.
Size adjectives before noun: 'une grande famille'. 'Grande' (feminine form of big).
Present tense: 'ils regardent' (they watch/are watching). 'La télé' (TV - informal).
Health states with être: 'être malade' (to be sick). 'Malade' is invariable.
Size adjectives before noun: 'un petit chien'. 'Petit' (masculine form of small).
Present tense: 'nous rentrons' (we go/are going home). 'À la maison' (home).
'La musique' (feminine). 'Forte' (feminine form of loud/strong) agrees with 'musique'.
Adjective before noun: 'un nouveau téléphone'. 'Nouveau' (masculine form of new).
Physical states with être: 'être fatigué' (to be tired). 'Fatigué' (masculine) / 'fatiguée' (feminine).
'Le pain' (masculine). 'Frais' (masculine form of fresh). 'Frais' → 'fraîche' (feminine).
Time expressions: 'demain' (tomorrow). 'Un examen' (a test/exam).
Present tense: 'elle prépare' (she prepares/is preparing). 'Le dîner' (dinner).
Present tense: 'j'apprends' (I learn/am learning). Languages with definite article.
Weather expressions: 'il fait beau' (it's nice weather). Impersonal 'il fait'.
Adjective before noun changes 'des' to 'de'. 'Beaux' (masculine plural of beautiful).
Sports with 'jouer au': 'jouer au football' (to play soccer). 'Au' = à + le.
Location with être + à. 'À l'école' (at school). 'L'' before vowel sound.
Hair descriptions: 'les cheveux bouclés' (curly hair). 'Bouclés' (masculine plural).
Adverb 'ensemble' (together). 'Heureux' (masculine plural) for mixed groups.
'Le magasin' (masculine). 'Fermé' (masculine form of closed) agrees with 'magasin'.

sentences.english: I have a lot of work.
sentences.explanation: Quantity expression: 'beaucoup de travail' (a lot of work). 'De' with quantities.
Present tense: 'tu portes' (you wear/are wearing). 'Des lunettes' (glasses - always plural).
'Le film' (masculine). 'Intéressant' (masculine form of interesting).
Present tense: 'nous écoutons' (we listen/are listening). 'De la musique' (music).
Intensifier 'très' (very). 'Intelligente' (feminine form of intelligent).
Present tense: 'je bois' (I drink/am drinking). 'De l'eau' (water) with partitive.
'Le parc' (masculine). 'Beau' (masculine form of beautiful). Irregular adjective.
Adjective before noun: 'une bonne idée'. 'Bonne' (feminine form of good).
Present tense: 'ils dansent' (they dance/are dancing). Regular -er verb.
Location with être + à. 'À l'hôpital' (at the hospital). 'L'' before vowel sound.
Adjective before noun: 'une belle voix'. 'Belle' (feminine form of beautiful).

sentences.english: We are going to the beach.
sentences.explanation: Present tense: 'nous allons' (we go/are going). 'À la plage' (to the beach).
'La nourriture' (feminine). 'Délicieuse' (feminine form of delicious).
Pain expressions: 'avoir mal à + body part'. 'Mal à la tête' (headache).
Superlative: 'mon meilleur ami' (my best friend). 'Meilleur' (masculine) / 'meilleure' (feminine).
'Le train' (masculine). 'Rapide' is invariable (same for masculine/feminine).
Reflexive verb: 'se amuser' (to have fun). 'Nous nous amusons' (we have fun).
Present tense: 'elle achète' (she buys/is buying). 'Du pain' (bread) with partitive.
Intensifier 'très' (very). 'Heureux' (masculine) / 'heureuse' (feminine) for happy.
'La chaise' (feminine). 'Confortable' is invariable (same for masculine/feminine).
Numbers with body parts. 'Cinq doigts' (five fingers - no article with numbers).
Present tense: 'tu manges' (you eat/are eating). 'Une pomme' (an apple - feminine).
'Le soleil' (masculine). 'Brillant' (masculine form of bright).

sentences.english: We are walking in the park.
sentences.explanation: Present tense: 'nous marchons' (we walk/are walking). 'Dans le parc' (in the park).
Color after noun: 'un sac jaune'. 'Jaune' is invariable (same for all genders).
Present tense: 'j'écris' (I write/am writing). Irregular verb 'écrire' (to write).
'La chambre' (feminine). 'Propre' is invariable (same for masculine/feminine).
Adjective before noun: 'une belle voiture'. 'Belle' (feminine form of beautiful).
Present tense: 'ils chantent' (they sing/are singing). 'Une chanson' (a song).
Physical sensations with avoir: 'avoir chaud' (to be hot). French uses avoir, not être.
'Le livre' (masculine). 'Épais' (masculine) / 'épaisse' (feminine) for thick.
Present tense: 'nous achetons' (we buy/are buying). 'Des courses' (groceries).
Coordinating conjunction 'et' (and). Two adjectives: 'grande et mince' (tall and thin).
Pain expressions: 'avoir mal au ventre' (to have a stomachache). 'Au' = à + le.
'L'eau' (feminine, contraction). 'Froide' (feminine form of cold) agrees with 'eau'.
Present tense: 'tu cours' (you run/are running). Adverb 'vite' (fast/quickly).
Size adjectives before noun: 'une grande maison'. 'Grande' (feminine form of big).
Present tense: 'je dors' (I sleep/am sleeping). Adverb 'bien' (well).
'Le ciel' (masculine). 'Bleu' (masculine form of blue) agrees with 'ciel'.
Present tense: 'nous préparons' (we prepare/are preparing). 'Le dîner' (dinner).
Hair descriptions: 'les cheveux courts' (short hair). 'Courts' (masculine plural).
Present tense: 'je travaille' (I work/am working). Time expression 'aujourd'hui' (today).
'La pizza' (feminine). 'Délicieuse' (feminine form of delicious).
Present tense: 'tu conduis' (you drive/are driving). Irregular verb 'conduire' (to drive).
'Ce sont' for identification. 'De vieux amis' (old friends - adjective before noun).
Reflexive verb: 'se brosser' (to brush). 'Je me brosse les dents' (I brush my teeth).
'La montagne' (feminine). 'Haute' (feminine form of high) agrees with 'montagne'.
Present tense: 'nous prenons' (we take/are taking). Irregular verb 'prendre' (to take).
Present tense: 'elle porte' (she wears/is wearing). 'Une jupe' (a skirt).
Pain expressions: 'avoir mal au dos' (to have a backache). 'Au' = à + le.
'L'herbe' (feminine, contraction). 'Verte' (feminine form of green) agrees with 'herbe'.
Musical instruments with 'jouer du': 'jouer du piano' (to play piano). 'Du' = de + le.
Present tense: 'ils lavent' (they wash/are washing). 'La vaisselle' (the dishes).
Reflexive verb: 'se sentir' (to feel). 'Je me sens bien' (I feel good).
'La glace' (feminine). 'Froide' (feminine form of cold) agrees with 'glace'.
Present tense: 'nous nettoyons' (we clean/are cleaning). Stem-changing verb.
Pet vocabulary: 'un chat domestique' (a pet cat). Adjective after noun.
Present tense: 'j'ouvre' (I open/am opening). Irregular verb 'ouvrir' (to open).
'La chemise' (feminine). 'Blanche' (feminine form of white) agrees with 'chemise'.
Present tense: 'tu fermes' (you close/are closing). Regular -er verb 'fermer' (to close).

sentences.english: They are swimming in the pool.
sentences.explanation: Present tense: 'ils nagent' (they swim/are swimming). 'Dans la piscine' (in the pool).
Present tense: 'j'appelle' (I call/am calling). Stem-changing verb 'appeler' (to call).
'L'arbre' (masculine, contraction). 'Grand' (masculine form of tall) agrees with 'arbre'.

sentences.english: We are waiting for the bus.
sentences.explanation: Present tense: 'nous attendons' (we wait/are waiting). Regular -re verb 'attendre' (to wait).
Reflexive verb: 'se peigner' (to comb one's hair). 'Elle se peigne' (she combs her hair).
Pain expressions: 'avoir mal aux dents' (to have a toothache). 'Aux' = à + les.
'La soupe' (feminine). 'Tiède' is invariable (same for masculine/feminine) meaning warm/lukewarm.
Present tense: 'tu aides' (you help/are helping). Possessive 'ta mère' (your mother).
Present tense: 'ils construisent' (they build/are building). Irregular verb 'construire' (to build).

sentences.english: I am putting on my shoes.
sentences.explanation: Present tense: 'je mets' (I put/am putting). Irregular verb 'mettre' (to put).
'L'horloge' (feminine, contraction). 'Cassée' (feminine form of broken) agrees with 'horloge'.
Present tense: 'nous plantons' (we plant/are planting). 'Des fleurs' (flowers).
Present tense: 'elle peint' (she paints/is painting). Irregular verb 'peindre' (to paint).

sentences.english: I am turning off the light.
sentences.explanation: Present tense: 'j'éteins' (I turn off/am turning off). Irregular verb 'éteindre' (to turn off).
'Le bébé' (masculine). 'Petit' (masculine form of small) agrees with 'bébé'.
Present tense: 'tu répares' (you fix/are fixing). Regular -er verb 'réparer' (to fix).
Present tense: 'ils traversent' (they cross/are crossing). Regular -er verb 'traverser' (to cross).

sentences.english: I am turning on the TV.
sentences.explanation: Present tense: 'j'allume' (I turn on/am turning on). Regular -er verb 'allumer' (to turn on).
'La rivière' (feminine). 'Profonde' (feminine form of deep) agrees with 'rivière'.
Present tense: 'nous cueillons' (we pick/are picking). Irregular verb 'cueillir' (to pick).

sentences.english: She is knocking on the door.
sentences.explanation: Present tense: 'elle frappe' (she knocks/is knocking). 'Frapper à la porte' (to knock on the door).
Present tense: 'je perds' (I lose/am losing). Regular -re verb 'perdre' (to lose).
'Le vent' (masculine). 'Fort' (masculine form of strong) agrees with 'vent'.
Reflexive verb: 'se laver' (to wash oneself). 'Tu te laves les mains' (you wash your hands).
Present tense: 'ils vendent' (they sell/are selling). Regular -re verb 'vendre' (to sell).
Present tense: 'je choisis' (I choose/am choosing). Regular -ir verb 'choisir' (to choose).
Present tense: 'le téléphone sonne' (the phone rings/is ringing). Regular -er verb 'sonner' (to ring).
Present tense: 'nous finissons' (we finish/are finishing). Regular -ir verb 'finir' (to finish).
Present tense: 'elle plie' (she folds/is folding). Regular -er verb 'plier' (to fold).
Present tense: 'je monte' (I climb/am climbing). Regular -er verb 'monter' (to go up/climb).
'Le feu' (masculine). 'Chaud' (masculine form of hot) agrees with 'feu'.
Present tense: 'tu lances' (you throw/are throwing). Regular -er verb 'lancer' (to throw).
Present tense: 'ils creusent' (they dig/are digging). Regular -er verb 'creuser' (to dig).
Present tense: 'je tire' (I pull/am pulling). Regular -er verb 'tirer' (to pull).
'La neige' (feminine). 'Blanche' (feminine form of white) agrees with 'neige'.
Present tense: 'nous poussons' (we push/are pushing). Regular -er verb 'pousser' (to push).
Present tense: 'elle coupe' (she cuts/is cutting). 'Du papier' (paper) with partitive.
Present tense: 'j'attrape' (I catch/am catching). Regular -er verb 'attraper' (to catch).
'La pierre' (feminine). 'Dure' (feminine form of hard) agrees with 'pierre'.
Present tense: 'tu mélanges' (you mix/are mixing). Regular -er verb 'mélanger' (to mix).
Present tense: 'ils mesurent' (they measure/are measuring). Regular -er verb 'mesurer' (to measure).
Present tense: 'je serre' (I shake/am shaking). 'Serrer la main' (to shake hands).
'L'oreiller' (masculine, contraction). 'Doux' (masculine form of soft) agrees with 'oreiller'.
Present tense: 'nous partageons' (we share/are sharing). Stem-changing verb 'partager' (to share).
Present tense: 'elle repasse' (she irons/is ironing). Regular -er verb 'repasser' (to iron).
Present tense: 'j'étire' (I stretch/am stretching). Regular -er verb 'étirer' (to stretch).
'Le jus' (masculine). 'Sucré' (masculine form of sweet) agrees with 'jus'.
Present tense: 'tu cires' (you polish/are polishing). Regular -er verb 'cirer' (to polish).
Present tense: 'ils chargent' (they load/are loading). Regular -er verb 'charger' (to load).
Present tense: 'j'épluche' (I peel/am peeling). Regular -er verb 'éplucher' (to peel).
'Le miroir' (masculine). 'Propre' is invariable (same for masculine/feminine) meaning clean.
Present tense: 'nous décorons' (we decorate/are decorating). Regular -er verb 'décorer' (to decorate).
Present tense: 'elle emballe' (she wraps/is wrapping). Regular -er verb 'emballer' (to wrap).
Present tense: 'j'essuie' (I wipe/am wiping). Stem-changing verb 'essuyer' (to wipe).
'Le pain' (masculine). 'Frais' (masculine form of fresh) agrees with 'pain'.
Present tense: 'tu ranges' (you organize/are organizing). Regular -er verb 'ranger' (to organize).
Present tense: 'ils récoltent' (they harvest/are harvesting). Regular -er verb 'récolter' (to harvest).
Present tense: 'je vérifie' (I check/am checking). Regular -er verb 'vérifier' (to check).
'Le gâteau' (masculine). 'Délicieux' (masculine form of delicious) agrees with 'gâteau'.
Reflexive verb: 's'habiller' (to get dressed). 'Je m'habille' (I get dressed).
'La lampe' (feminine). 'Brillante' (feminine form of bright) agrees with 'lampe'.
Present tense: 'tu comptes' (you count/are counting). 'L'argent' (money - contraction).
Reflexive verb: 'se reposer' (to rest). 'Ils se reposent' (they rest/are resting).
Present tense: 'je fais' (I make/am making). 'Du café' (coffee) with partitive.
'Le jardin' (masculine). 'Beau' (masculine form of beautiful) agrees with 'jardin'.
Idiomatic expression: 'faire ses valises' (to pack suitcases). 'Nos valises' (our suitcases).
Present tense: 'elle répond' (she answers/is answering). 'Au téléphone' (to the phone).

sentences.english: I am looking for my keys.
sentences.explanation: Present tense: 'je cherche' (I look for/am looking for). 'Mes clés' (my keys).
'La rue' (feminine). 'Animée' (feminine form of busy/lively) agrees with 'rue'.
Present tense: 'tu économises' (you save/are saving). 'De l'argent' (money) with partitive.
Games with 'jouer aux': 'jouer aux cartes' (to play cards). 'Aux' = à + les.
Reflexive verb: 'se lever' (to get up). 'Je me lève tôt' (I get up early).
'L'ordinateur' (masculine, contraction). 'Neuf' (masculine form of new/brand new).
Idiomatic expression: 'rendre visite à' (to visit someone). Complex structure.
Reflexive verb: 'se maquiller' (to put on makeup). 'Elle se maquille' (she puts on makeup).
Present tense: 'j'emprunte' (I borrow/am borrowing). 'Un livre' (a book).
Weather expressions: 'il fait mauvais' (the weather is bad). Impersonal 'il fait'.
Present tense: 'tu racontes' (you tell/are telling). 'Une histoire' (a story).
Present tense: 'ils déménagent' (they move house/are moving). Single verb for moving house.
Reflexive verb: 'se sentir' (to feel). 'Je me sens fatigué' (I feel tired).
'Le restaurant' (masculine). 'Cher' (masculine form of expensive) agrees with 'restaurant'.
Present tense: 'nous fêtons' (we celebrate/are celebrating). 'Un anniversaire' (a birthday).
Activities with 'faire du': 'faire du yoga' (to do yoga). 'Du' = de + le.
Present tense: 'je gare' (I park/am parking). 'La voiture' (the car).
'L'hôtel' (masculine, contraction). 'Confortable' is invariable (same for all genders).
Present tense: 'tu arroses' (you water/are watering). 'Les plantes' (the plants).
Reflexive verb: 'se disputer' (to argue). 'Ils se disputent' (they argue/are arguing).
Reflexive verb: 'se marier' (to get married). 'Je me marie' (I get married).
'La plage' (feminine). 'Bondée' (feminine form of crowded) agrees with 'plage'.
Meals with 'prendre': 'prendre le petit-déjeuner' (to have breakfast). Complex meal term.
Present tense: 'elle tricote' (she knits/is knitting). 'Un pull' (a sweater).
Present tense: 'j'oublie' (I forget/am forgetting). 'Quelque chose' (something).
'Le cinéma' (masculine). 'Sombre' is invariable (same for masculine/feminine) meaning dark.
Present tense: 'tu changes de' (you change). 'Changer de vêtements' (to change clothes).
Present tense: 'ils divorcent' (they get divorced/are getting divorced). Life event verb.
Reflexive verb: 'se souvenir de' (to remember). Complex structure with 'de'.
'La bibliothèque' (feminine). 'Silencieuse' (feminine form of quiet) agrees with 'bibliothèque'.
Idiomatic expression: 'faire les courses' (to go shopping/grocery shopping).
Reflexive verb: 'se fâcher' (to get angry). 'Elle se fâche' (she gets angry).
Present tense: 'je maigris' (I lose weight/am losing weight). Regular -ir verb 'maigrir'.
'Le musée' (masculine). 'Intéressant' (masculine form of interesting) agrees with 'musée'.
Present tense: 'tu grossis' (you gain weight/are gaining weight). Regular -ir verb 'grossir'.
Reflexive verb: 'se préparer' (to get ready). 'Ils se préparent' (they get ready).
Idiomatic expression: 'prendre une douche' (to take a shower). Uses 'prendre' not reflexive.
'L'aéroport' (masculine, contraction). 'Animé' (masculine form of busy) agrees with 'aéroport'.
Reflexive verb: 'se dépêcher' (to hurry). 'Nous nous dépêchons' (we hurry).
Idiomatic expression: 'prendre un bain' (to take a bath). Uses 'prendre' not reflexive.
Reflexive verb: 's'ennuyer' (to get bored). 'Je m'ennuie' (I get bored).
'Le magasin' (masculine). 'Ouvert' (masculine form of open) agrees with 'magasin'.
Reflexive verb: 'se perdre' (to get lost). 'Tu te perds' (you get lost).
Reflexive verb: 'se fiancer' (to get engaged). 'Ils se fiancent' (they get engaged).
Idiomatic expression: 'faire une erreur' (to make a mistake). Uses 'faire'.
'La banque' (feminine). 'Fermée' (feminine form of closed) agrees with 'banque'.
Idiomatic expression: 'faire des progrès' (to make progress). 'Des progrès' (progress - plural).
Reflexive verb: 's'inquiéter' (to worry/get worried). 'Elle s'inquiète' (she worries).
Reflexive expression: 'se faire des amis' (to make friends). Complex reflexive structure.
'La poste' (feminine). 'Loin' is invariable (same for all genders) meaning far.
Idiomatic expression: 'faire du bruit' (to make noise). 'Du bruit' (noise) with partitive.
Idiomatic expression: 'tomber malade' (to get sick). 'Malades' (sick - plural adjective).
Health expression: 'aller mieux' (to get better/feel better). Uses 'aller' + 'mieux'.
'La pharmacie' (feminine). 'Près' is invariable (same for all genders) meaning near.
Present tense: 'nous vieillissons' (we get older/are getting older). Regular -ir verb 'vieillir'.
Emotion with avoir: 'avoir peur' (to be scared/afraid). French uses avoir, not être.
Present tense: 'je prépare' (I prepare/am preparing). 'Le dîner' (dinner).
'L'école' (feminine, contraction). 'Grande' (feminine form of big) agrees with 'école'.
Reflexive verb: 'se tromper' (to make a mistake/get confused). 'Tu te trompes' (you're wrong).
Idiomatic expression: 'faire des projets' (to make plans). 'Des projets' (plans/projects).
Physical state with avoir: 'avoir faim' (to be hungry). French uses avoir, not être.
'L'église' (feminine, contraction). 'Vieille' (feminine form of old) agrees with 'église'.
Present tense: 'nous faisons' (we make/are making). 'Un gâteau' (a cake).
Physical state with avoir: 'avoir sommeil' (to be sleepy). French uses avoir, not être.
Idiomatic expression: 'faire une réservation' (to make a reservation). Uses 'faire'.
'Le pont' (masculine). 'Long' (masculine form of long) agrees with 'pont'.
Present tense: 'tu deviens' (you become/are becoming). 'Devenir' (to become) + adjective.
Idiomatic expression: 'faire de la musique' (to make music). 'De la musique' (music).
Present tense: 'je deviens' (I become/am becoming). 'Devenir' (to become) + adjective.
'Le marché' (masculine). 'Animé' (masculine form of busy/lively) agrees with 'marché'.
Idiomatic expression: 'prendre une décision' (to make a decision). Uses 'prendre' not 'faire'.
Reflexive verb: 's'exciter' (to get excited). 'Elle s'excite' (she gets excited).
Idiomatic expression: 'prendre rendez-vous' (to make an appointment). Fixed expression.
'Le bureau' (masculine). 'Moderne' is invariable (same for masculine/feminine).

sentences.english: You are getting ready to leave.
sentences.explanation: Reflexive verb + infinitive: 'se préparer à' (to get ready to). Complex structure.
Idiomatic expression: 'faire du désordre' (to make a mess). 'Du désordre' (mess/disorder).

sentences.english: I am getting used to it.
sentences.explanation: Reflexive verb: 's'habituer' (to get used to). 'Je m'habitue' (I get used to it).
'Le stade' (masculine). 'Énorme' is invariable (same for masculine/feminine) meaning huge.
Idiomatic expression: 'faire un effort' (to make an effort). 'Un effort' (an effort).
Present tense: 'elle devient' (she becomes/is becoming). 'Jalouse' (feminine form of jealous).
Idiomatic expression: 'faire une liste' (to make a list). Uses 'faire' not 'écrire'.
'Le château' (masculine). 'Ancien' (masculine form of ancient/old) agrees with 'château'.
Comparative: 'devenir plus fort' (to become stronger). 'Plus' + adjective for comparison.
Idiomatic expression: 'faire un film' (to make a film). Uses 'faire' for creating.
Physical state with avoir: 'avoir le vertige' (to be dizzy/have vertigo). Fixed expression.
'La forêt' (feminine). 'Dense' is invariable (same for masculine/feminine) meaning dense.
Present tense: 'nous faisons' (we make/are making). 'Une vidéo' (a video).
Idiomatic expression: 'avoir le mal du pays' (to be homesick). Complex fixed expression.
Present tense: 'je fais' (I make/am making). 'Un sandwich' (a sandwich).
'La vallée' (feminine). 'Verte' (feminine form of green) agrees with 'vallée'.

sentences.english: You are getting better at French.
sentences.explanation: Present tense: 'tu progresses' (you progress/are progressing). 'En français' (in French).
Idiomatic expression: 'faire l'histoire' (to make history). 'L'histoire' (history).
